metadata.dc:author: Miró Palau, V
Quesada Carmona, A
Ten Morro, F
Osca Asensi, J
Osa Sáez, A M
Morillas Blasco, P
metadata.dc:description: Early infectious endocarditis occurs in 3% of prostheses in the first 12 months after valvular surgery and is more aggressive than late prosthetic endocarditis. Mortality remains high, especially in early cases, despite combined medical and surgical treatment. Clinical manifestations of early cases are due to both bacteremia and prosthetic malfunction, and is mainly caused by staphylococci. We present a case report of early prosthetic endocarditis in aortic prostheses complicated with severe aortic regurgitation and right atria-aortic root fistula with auriculoventricular and intraventricular disturbance in electrocardiogram.
metadata.dc:title: Fístula aorta-aurícula derecha como complicación de endocarditis protésica precoz.
[A right aorto-atrial fistula as a complication of early prosthetic endocarditis].
